text: Meenakshi Narain (May 9, 1964 â€“ January 1, 2023) was an Indian-born American experimental physicist. She took part in the discovery of the top quark in 1995 and the Higgs boson in 2012. She was a professor of physics and chair of the department of physics at Brown University. She also worked at Boston University. Narain was born in Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh. She was married to German citizen Ulrich Heintz. She had two children. She died on January 1, 2023, in Providence, Rhode Island. She was 58. ==References== == Other websites == * (video, 13:11 minutes) Category:1964 births Category:2023 deaths Category:Brown University faculty Category:American physicists Category:Indian physicists Category:People from Uttar Pradesh Category:Boston University faculty
title: Meenakshi Narain
